page.title: 12SCHOOLS IN FERNESS
page.content: The parish school for Ardclach was situated first on the west bank of the River Findhorn. At that time this upland farming area was the main centre of population. When the village of Ferness was built by the local landowner, included within it was a new school building at first maintained privately. Additional private schools in the parish also existed at Fornighty, Achnatone and Dulsie. In 1890 Ferness school took over from Ardclach as the parish school. In the period 1951- 1976 the other schools closed one by one leaving Ferness as the only single- teacher school in the county. Until recent decades the roll (formerly up to about 50 pupils ) demanded a second teacher to be employed.
